newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran condemns Israel settlement plan.
newsitem.headline: Iran condemns Israel settlement plan.

text.p: Iran on Saturday condemned Israeli plans to build housing for Jews in Arab East Jerusalem and called on Moslem states to respond firmly, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said.

It quoted Deputy Foreign Minister Hossein Sheikholeslam as saying the "Islamic Republic considered Palestine as a totally integrated nation no part of which is capable of being ceded to the occupying enemy".
"The so-called Middle East peace process has been a failure from the outset and has fallen short of securing the least rights of Arabs and Moslems," he added.

Israel's approval on Wednesday of the plan to build 6,500 houses in Jabal Abu Ghneim or Har Homa has sparked criticism from its key ally the United States and Palestinian warnings that it could unleash bloodshed.
Israel says all of Jerusalem is its capital. Palestinians consider Arab East Jerusalem, seized by Israel in the 1967 Middle East war, the capital of a future Palestinian state.
